title: Solution
text:
Solution:

1) Start by factoring all possible expressions.
• Factor the denominator x² + $$5x$$ + $$6$$ in the first fraction:
x² + $$5x$$ + $$6$$ $$=$$ (x + 2)(x + 3).
• Factor the numerator x² - $$4$$ in the second fraction:
x² - $$4$$ $$=$$ (x - 2)(x + 2).

2) Rewrite each fraction with these factors:
( (5x) / ( (x + 2)(x + 3) ) ) * ( ( (x - 2)(x + 2) ) / (10x) ).

3) Combine into a single fraction:
$$=$$ ( $$5x$$ * (x - 2)(x + 2) ) / ( (x + 2)(x + 3) * $$10x$$ ).

4) Cancel common factors:
• Cancel $$5x$$ with $$10x$$ to get $$ rac{1}{2}$$.
• Cancel (x + 2) from numerator and denominator.

5) The simplified expression becomes:
(x - 2) / (2(x + 3)).

Answer: (x - 2) / [2(x + 3)].
